title: Designing Pre-Clinical Curricula for Medical Schools: Utilizing Self-Directed Learning Guides (SLG)

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of basic medicine and clinical practice
context.additional_context: An intensive training program for current practitioners, combining Self-Directed Learning Guides (SLGs) with Project-Based Learning (PBL) in a digital device-supported educational environment

learning_goals: Learners can acquire pre-clinical knowledge (anatomy, physiology, pathology, etc.) with over 90% accuracy using SLG.
Learners can apply knowledge acquired through SLG to real-world clinical case analysis via PBL activities.
Learners can collaborate with peers in Team-Based Learning (TBL) to propose solutions for clinical problem-solving.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
